steps.title: Launch & land on Dashboard
details: All tests begin by opening http://localhost:5173 without issue.

steps.title: Open “Add New Task” modal
details: User clicks the global “+ / Add Task” button.
Modal appears, but UI review flags inconsistent typography, padding and button styling.

steps.title: Fill out task fields (name, description, deadline, category, colour, emoji)
details: Typing and picker interactions generally work, but many alignment / spacing / contrast issues are recorded.
Colour & category dropdowns are visually noisy.

steps.title: Submit the task via “Create Task”
details: In the Drag-and-Move scenario the click is blocked by the still-open category pop-over causing a 5 s timeout. This is a hard failure stopping the remainder of that flow.

steps.title: Observe confirmation / new task in list
details: Some scenarios show the task appearing; others never surface a toast or list update, leaving testers uncertain if save worked.

steps.title: Additional task actions (complete, move, pin, duplicate, edit, delete)
details: Mark done / not-done and pin flows finish but screens lack clear visual state change or snack-bar feedback.
Move (drag-and-drop) never reached because creation failed.
Duplicate & Edit succeed but rely on the same modal with the same UI consistency issues.
Delete flow completes but feedback message/screenshot timing is inconsistent.

steps.title: Settings – Appearance
details: Dark-mode, theme, glow-effect toggles can be switched, yet several planned assertions remain pending (e.g. Reduce Motion ‘System’).
UI checklist again flags padding/typography issues.

emotional_arc: User starts confident (app loads quickly) → mild irritation (visual polish feels unfinished) → rising friction (long scrolls within modal, dropdown clutter) → major frustration when “Create Task” cannot be clicked (blocked by overlay) → uncertainty (no clear success feedback) → partial relief when later flows succeed → lingering doubt about reliability & visual quality.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: A category pop-over intercepting clicks prevents saving a task—core workflow stopper.
next_actions: Auto-close pop-over when a value is chosen or when user clicks outside.
Disable pointer-events for hidden menu layers.
Add e2e test that tries to click “Create Task” immediately after selecting a category.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users aren’t sure if actions (save, delete, duplicate) worked; leads to double input or abandonment.
next_actions: Show toast/snack-bar with concise copy (e.g. “Task created”) and fade after 2–3 s.
Ensure list auto-scrolls to new/updated task.
Add ARIA live-region for screen-reader parity.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent fonts and cramped layouts make the UI feel unprofessional and hamper scannability.
next_actions: Establish type scale (e.g. 16/24/32 px) and apply via design tokens.
Use consistent 8-pt spacing grid for padding/margins.
Audit CSS for duplicate ad-hoc font-weight overrides.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Mismatched sizes/colours reduce recognisability and hurt brand perception.
next_actions: Define primary / secondary / ghost button variants in design system.
Replace ad-hoc class combinations with those tokens.
Run automated visual regression on buttons.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Misaligned labels and low-contrast colours slow form completion and fail WCAG AA.
next_actions: Wrap each label+input in flex column or grid.
Run automated a11y check for 4.5:1 contrast.

first_tackles.description: Fix category pop-over so it no longer blocks the “Create Task” button (auto-close / z-index).
Add toast/snack-bar confirmations for create, edit, delete, duplicate actions.
Create global button component and swap out inconsistent instances.
Apply consistent 8-pt spacing & type scale to the Add/Edit Task modal (highest screen-time).
Improve contrast of text vs. background, starting with category pills & settings panel.
